result.execSummary:
The defendant David L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara County Case No. 21CT71

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L Peterson

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for David L Peterson
Current: 350 Main Street #7, Wild Rose, wi 54984 United States  (Effective: 05-16-2022)
Prior: E1698 Akron Ave, Waupaca, WI 54981

22CM29, 21CT71 & 21TR2352 Cases called @ 3:04 PM Defendant David L Peterson appeared in court with Attorney Christine Bruen. Attorney Wesley Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CM29 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. 21CT71 - Amended complaint stated. Receipt admitted - reading waived. 21CM29 & 21CT71 - Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 21CT71: Ct 1 - NC. 22CM29 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 21TR2352 - DRI. 21CT71: Ct 2- Dismissed outright. 22CT71: Cts 3 & 4 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: As to 21CT71 only - $1200 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, $42.50 Blood Draw fee w/ 60 DTP or PP, 27 mo DL revocation/IID, 85 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, 2 days CFTS, sentence to commence forthwith. As to both cases - AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
